instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 2009 MacBook Pro back light fuse orientation?
threads.message:
2009 MacBook Pro back light fuse orientation?

hello, I am repairing a MacBook Pro 2009 12 inch back light issue, the previous fuse was removed  before I received the MacBook, it does not look like there’s any left or right up or down or pin #1 etc. Can you confirm whether it matters which Direction the fuse goes?

threads.title: 2009 MacBook Pro back light fuse orientation?
threads.message:
A fuse doesn't have orientation.
Just be sure no short to ground on any pad, before powering up the board.
